newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Wolford knocked down by profit rumours.
newsitem.headline: Wolford knocked down by profit rumours.

text.p: Shares in hosiery maker Wolford dropped nine percent in Vienna on Thursday on market rumours that expansion costs in Asia and the United States may weigh on 1996/97 earnings, traders said.
At 1240 GMT Wolford shares were 118 schillings down at 1,292 on volume of 23,744. Earlier the stock touched a low of 1,250 schillings.
"The selling is coming from London and the United States. It seems the rumours started with a Wolford presentation in the United States on Wednesday," a Vienna share trader said.
A spokesman for Wolford rejected speculation that profits in the 1996/97 financial year would come in below forecast.
"The rumours are absolutely without basis. We are completely on target. Nothing has changed since our half-year news conference (in December)," the spokesman said.

In the six months to October 31, 1996 Wolford reported a nine percent rise in net profit to 106.9 million schillings. It forecast full-year sales would reach 1.7 billion schillings, surpassing the previous year's 1.475 billion record, while net profit growth would outstrip sales.
Some traders said they expected a recovery in Wolford shares once investors returned from the Easter holiday break.
"Today's selling was into a thin market," said one. -- Janet McBride, Vienna newsroom +43-1 531 12254
